Sentencas: Degradation mechanisms within solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) during thermal cycling limit operational start-up times and cell lifetime, and must therefore be better understood and mitigated.
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation

Sentencas: This work explores such mechanisms using digital volume correlation (DVC) techniques applied to lab-based X-ray tomograms where the microstructural evolution is evaluated during the operational cycling of a Ni-YSZ/YSZ cell.
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation

Sentencas: To emulate reduced start-up times, five tomograms were collected over four operational thermal cycles to 750 degrees C at various ramp-rates: 3, 10, 20 and 30 degrees C min(-1).
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation

Sentencas: Two key features are observed in the 3D strain profiles.
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation

Sentencas: Firstly, during low ramp-rates the material produces microscopic channels towards cluster-points.
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation

Sentencas: This is thought to be caused by the ceramic skeleton inhibiting the effects of sintering.
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation

Sentencas: Secondly, previously unseen macroscopic waves' developed after high-rate cycling, consisting of linear regions of compression and tension throughout the sample.
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation

Sentencas: These wave features decay away from a heterogeneous defect which is thought to be responsible for the non-uniform strain profile.
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation

Sentencas: This work demonstrates the first use of sub-micron DVC computations applied to an SOFC exposed to operationally relevant temperatures.
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation

Sentencas: These findings will assist in the development of new electrode materials from their fabrication to operation, ultimately supporting commercial viability of SOFCs.
Titulo: Evaluating microstructure evolution in an SOFC electrode using digital volume correlation
